applicant had vilified the noncriminal professional activity of dr st by implying that he committed criminal act and interfered with the relationship of trust between doctor and patient which deserved the applicant were born in and respectively and live in lecco the first applicant is the editor of a local online newspaper in the province of lecco the other two applicant are journalist working for the newspaper in the course of their activity the applicant used radio equipment to access frequency used by the police or the carabinieri this enabled them to learn of any communication transmitted in that way so that they could arrive quickly on the scene when wishing to report on specific incident on august the applicant listened in on a conversation during which the merate carabinieri operation centre decided to send a patrol to a location where according to anonymous source weapon had been stored illegally the carabinieri accordingly went to the location mentioned and the second and third applicant arrived on the scene immediately afterwards having obtained a search warrant the carabinieri searched the applicant car finding two frequencymodulation transmitterreceivers that were capable of intercepting police radio communication the carabinieri then went to the two journalist editorial office and seized two fixed radio receiver which were tuned to the frequency used by the carabinieri other frequency used by police operation centre were stored in the device memory a the criminal proceeding against the applicant at first instance criminal proceeding were instituted against the first and second applicant for illegally installing equipment designed to intercept communication between lawenforcement agency operation centre and patrol article bi and bi of the criminal code the third applicant wa charged with accessing the aforementioned communication article and bi of the criminal code on november the lecco district court acquitted the applicant it held that the relevant article of the criminal code were to be interpreted in the light of article of the constitution which only protected communication of a confidential nature the district court observed that the radio device used by the lawenforcement agency wa unable to ensure the confidentiality of the information it transmitted accordingly the interception of the communication in question did not constitute an offence moreover the possession and use of radio receiver were not prohibited a such b proceeding on appeal the milan principal public prosecutor and the lecco public prosecutor appealed they argued that the lecco district court interpretation wa inconsistent with the court of cassations caselaw in such matter citing in particular judgment no of january and that the communication in issue were clearly confidential bearing in mind the aim of ensuring public safety and protecting public order in addition the communication concerned the initial investigation following the commission of an offence they were therefore subject to a confidentiality requirement pursuant to article of the code of criminal procedure the confidential nature of the communication wa also obvious from the fact that the carabinieri used coded language for communication concerning the location and the type of intervention clearly seeking to ensure that no third party had knowledge of the information being exchanged in addition the radiofrequencies involved had been exclusively assigned to operation centre by the ministry of defence furthermore in order to listen in on the conversation the applicant had had to purchase special radio equipment a ordinary equipment could not be used for this purpose on the other hand the fact that such device were freely available on the market did not justify their use for intercepting conversation between lawenforcement officer in addition in accordance with presidential decree no a in force at the material time device of this kind were intended to be purchased by amateur radio operator but could not be used to intercept police radiofrequencies lastly the ministry of communication decree of february had expressly prohibited amateur radio operator from intercepting communication which they were not entitled to receive c judgment of the milan court of appeal in a judgment of may the milan court of appeal found the first and second applicant guilty and sentenced them to one year and three month imprisonment the third applicant wa sentenced to six month imprisonment the court of appeal suspended the applicant sentence it observed that article bi of the criminal code a amended by law no of november had extended the scope of criminal responsibility to cover all remote data transmission thus including the interception of conversation between the lawenforcement agency operation centre and patrol such communication were moreover clearly confidential reiterating all the argument put forward by the milan and lecco public prosecutor particularly regarding the aim of ensuring public safety and protecting public order the court of appeal held that article of the code of criminal procedure wa also at issue in the present case d proceeding in the court of cassation the applicant appealed to the court of cassation they contended that the communication in question had been transmitted on unencrypted frequency and thus could not be treated a confidential furthermore they had been acting in a professional capacity a journalist and their action were therefore justified under article of the criminal code and in term of freedom of the press in a judgment of october the court of cassation found against the applicant upholding the court of appeal position a to the confidential nature of the communication and reiterating that this interpretation wa consistent with it own approach in similar case particularly in judgment no of may and no of january addressing the applicant argument concerning freedom of the press the court of cassation stated that the right to impart information which they had relied on might have prevailed over the public interest protected by criminal law in a case of alleged defamation however that right could not take precedence in a case concerning the illegal interception of communication between lawenforcement officer the
